meanings.definition: A person who cuts or slices food into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The dicer skillfully chopped the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new dicer for my kitchen to make cooking easier.
meanings.sent3: The dicer accidentally cut the carrots into tiny cubes, making them look like colorful building blocks.
meanings.sent4: She was a true dicer in the kitchen, turning whole fruits into perfectly diced pieces with ease.
meanings.sent5: The dicer's precision with the knife was unmatched, creating beautifully cut ingredients for the dish.

meanings.definition: A device used for cutting food into small, uniform pieces.
meanings.sent1: The dicer on the countertop made quick work of the onions, saving time in meal preparation.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to clean the dicer thoroughly after each use to maintain its sharpness.
meanings.sent3: The dicer sat patiently on the shelf, waiting to be called into action for the next cooking session.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, the dicer transformed the large potato into perfectly diced pieces for the stew.
meanings.sent5: The dicer's blades gleamed under the kitchen lights, ready to tackle any vegetable thrown its way.
